page.title: 14SPECIAL EDUCATION IN SCHOOLS
page.content: Two schools have special educat- ional units on their site. Kingsley School has a partially hearing unit for 4-11 year olds. The unit has equipment so the children can have lessons in their own classrooms and join in less- ons in the main school. If there are some children in other schools who need help because they have hearing diffic- ulties, teachers can get help and advice from Kingsley. An Oralographic Unit is also based at Kingsley; this is for children who have reading problems The children go to the unit every day for one hour until the course has finished, then they are able to return to the classroom. West Thornton School has two special units, one for gipsy children, and one for children with speech problems. Children can join this unit at any age and stay until their speech has improved.
